title: Figma Launches Three AI-Powered Image Editing Tools to Streamline Design Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—designed to eliminate the friction of switching between design platforms for routine visual edits.Released on December 10, 2025, these features mark a significant step toward making Figma a more self-contained creative hub, reducing the need for designers to export assets to external tools like Photoshop or Canva.The tools are now available in Figma Design and Figma Draw for users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled.Figma has consolidated these new capabilities alongside existing features like Remove background and Crop into a revamped contextual toolbar for easier access.

paragraphs.content: The update addresses a persistent workflow bottleneck: designers frequently need to leave Figma for minor image adjustments, then reimport the refined assets back into their projects.By embedding precise editing tools directly into the design canvas, Figma aims to accelerate decision-making in cross-functional reviews and reduce dependencies on specialized design team support for routine tasks.The company plans to extend these tools to additional products across its platform in 2026, signaling broader integration of AI-assisted editing across Figma's ecosystem.This launch arrives as competitors like Adobe simultaneously integrate similar capabilities into ChatGPT, highlighting a wider industry push to embed AI editing where designers already work.

sections.title: Precision Editing Without Prompts: How the Three Tools Work

paragraphs.content: **Erase object** allows designers to select and remove unwanted elements from images with a single click, streamlining common tasks like background cleanup and object removal for UI mockups.**Isolate object** lets users separate a subject from its surroundings and apply targeted effects—including blur, lighting adjustments, color correction, desaturation, shadow, and focus changes—while preserving the underlying background characteristics.For example, a designer working on a product shot can brighten key components and desaturate the rest, or remove distracting elements entirely.Unlike generative AI tools that rely on natural language prompts, Figma's tools operate through direct selection and manipulation, prioritizing designer control over algorithmic suggestions.

paragraphs.content: **Expand image** addresses the formatting challenge of adapting assets across multiple touchpoints by extending an image's background to fit new aspect ratios—such as converting a square product shot into a landscape web banner.An upgraded lasso selection tool enhances precision, enabling stable edits that avoid the unnatural distortions sometimes produced by AI-assisted image manipulation.These capabilities work seamlessly within the Figma canvas, eliminating the export-edit-reimport cycle that has historically disrupted design workflows.The consolidated toolbar highlights background removal as the most frequently used action among Figma users, reflecting its importance for brand consistency and rapid UI iteration.

paragraphs.content: For performance marketers and content teams, these tools unlock faster iteration cycles by enabling in-house edits without waiting for design team support on routine adjustments.A designer can now reposition objects, clean backgrounds, and adapt assets for different formats—such as desktop, mobile, and social media—without context-switching between applications.Cross-functional design reviews benefit from immediate visualization of proposed edits, as stakeholders can see variations on-the-fly during mockup discussions rather than waiting for formal design revisions.ContentGrip notes that this capability directly addresses a "pain point marketers know well," where visual tweaks often require coordination across departments or multiple platforms.

Figma's launch positions the platform as a competitive response to Adobe and Canva, which have offered object removal and editing features for several years.However, Figma's approach differs strategically: rather than competing on generative image creation—a space where tools like Nano Banana already operate—the company emphasizes precise, context-aware editing that maintains designer autonomy.TechCrunch reports that the simultaneous rollout of Adobe's AI editing features within ChatGPT underscores an industry-wide trend toward embedding AI capabilities in user-familiar environments rather than requiring adoption of specialized standalone tools.With expansion to additional Figma products planned for 2026, the company signals confidence in these capabilities as foundational to its long-term platform vision.
